intro: Aeollanthus plicatus, commonly known as the pleated aeollanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive pleated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
